title: Are co-ed classrooms in Maharashtra a step towards equality or a cultural challenge?
description: Maharashtra will no longer permit single-gender schools, mandating all institutions to become co-ed. The policy aims to foster gender equality, mutual respect, and social skills, while merging boys’ and girls’ schools under one registration. Critics caution that cultural and regional sensitivities may affect implementation, especially in conservative communities, making careful planning, teacher training, and community engagement essential for success.

title: SC questions HC order for SIT probe into Karur stampede
description: The Supreme Court questioned the Madras High Court's principal bench for ordering an SIT probe into the Karur stampede, bypassing the Madurai bench's jurisdiction and the original petition's focus on rally protocols. Justices Maheshwari and Anjaria also queried Tamil Nadu on permitting the rally despite denying others and the unusual midnight postmortems. TVK sought a retired SC judge's supervision for the probe, citing concerns over state officials' impartiality.

title: 'It breaks my heart': Meghalaya woman alleges racial abuse twice in an hour in Delhi
description: A Meghalaya flight attendant alleged verbal racial abuse twice in Delhi within an hour, sparking outrage after her video went viral. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju condemned the incidents, urging action against such discrimination and emphasizing India's diversity and equality for all citizens.

title: Repatriate pregnant woman: Bangladesh court to Indian mission
description: A pregnant woman, wrongly deported to Bangladesh as an "illegal immigrant," is set to return to India following a judicial order. Sunali Khatun and five others, identified by Aadhaar cards, were pushed across the border by Delhi Police. A Bangladeshi court has directed the Indian High Commission to facilitate their safe repatriation, highlighting concerns over the police's hasty actions and the plight of the detained individuals.

Supreme Court seeks government, EC response on allowing undertrials to vote
description: A Public Interest Litigation in the Supreme Court questions why undertrial prisoners, presumed innocent, are denied voting rights under Section 62(5) of the Representation of People Act. The petition highlights that an estimated five lakh undertrials are disenfranchised, a situation contrasting with practices in other nations. The court has sought responses from the Centre and the Election Commission, though a similar plea was dismissed previously.

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari demands action against CM Mamata Banerjee for ‘threatening Chief Electoral Officer’
description: Suvendu Adhikari also demanded that by Monday, the Chief Minister must submit proof of the corruption allegations that she levelled against the CEO, and the complaints of the electoral officers who were allegedly intimidated

title: Trade war reignites: Trump announces new 100% tariff on Chinese goods; impact from Nov 1
description: President Trump announced 100% tariffs on Chinese products starting November 1, citing China's "hostile" restrictions on rare earth mineral exports. He warned of a potential trade war escalation, impacting global markets. China stated the curbs are for national security, affecting industries reliant on these minerals.

title: Bharatpur institution seeks PM’s intervention for development of Mewat region
description: The Samriddh Bharat Abhiyan has pointed out that unemployment is the biggest issue confronting the youth in the region

title: Eight Indians, 10 firms face US sanctions over Iran oil link
description: America has sanctioned eight Indian individuals and ten companies. These actions are due to their involvement in trading Iranian oil. The US state department and treasury targeted numerous entities globally. Several Indian firms are accused of importing Iranian-origin petrochemicals and LPG. These shipments were destined for China and Pakistan. The sanctions highlight ongoing efforts to curb Iran's oil trade.

title: Was imprisoned 3 months after he landed; Learnt Russian for his education there: Mother of Morbi boy captured by Ukraine Army

Officials inspect gutted shops at Taliparamba; report to be submitted to govt.
India elevates its ties with Taliban, to reopen embassy
description: India announced it will upgrade its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy during Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's visit, signaling a boost in diplomatic ties. New projects and humanitarian aid were also pledged, with both nations condemning cross-border terrorism and agreeing to enhance cooperation.

title: Former Nepal PM asks why Army could not protect govt secretariat
Kayla Nicole backs diss tracks amid Taylor Swift ‘Opalite’ drama
description: Taylor Swift's new album has fans buzzing, with one song sparking speculation about Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole. Instead of engaging in online drama, Nicole used her podcast to advocate for artists settling disputes through music, citing Cardi B and Nicki Minaj. She also subtly responded on social media, demonstrating a calm approach to celebrity gossip.

Maharashtra govt sets up monitoring panel: GR states 35 percent land to be reserved for open spaces in SRA projects
Russell Westbrook gets huge China offer as LeBron scapegoat rumors persist
description: Russell Westbrook, a free agent after his time with the Denver Nuggets, is reportedly considering a massive offer from an unnamed Chinese team. This deal is rumored to be quadruple what the Sacramento Kings could have offered. The move comes after Westbrook faced scapegoating during his tenure with the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Watch: Who is Venezuela’s Maria Corina Machado, the winner of the Nobel Peace Prize 2025?
description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize — honoured for keeping the flame of democracy alive under Nicolas Maduro’s rule. Her win comes after a year of election crackdowns, mass arrests, and deadly protests that have pushed Venezuela deeper into political turmoil.

Cough syrup row: Another sample from same batch of Coldrif fails testing
description: Another batch of Coldrif cough syrup tested positive for diethylene glycol, prompting MPFDA to ban three syrups and initiate a market recall. Coldrif, linked to 23 child deaths in Chhindwara, was primarily distributed locally, while Respifresh and Relife reached numerous districts across Madhya Pradesh.

title: Police brutality in MP: Two on-duty cops beat DSP’s relative to death
description: A 21-year-old man died after allegedly being beaten by two on-duty policemen in Bhopal. Udit Gayaki, who had recently returned from Bengaluru, was celebrating with friends when the constables reportedly assaulted him and demanded money. He later complained of uneasiness and was declared dead at AIIMS Bhopal.

title: ‘3.75 lakh Indians visited Sri Lanka till September this year’
Man kills nephew over sewing unit dispute; chops body into 5 pieces, dumps in rivulet
description: A dispute over a jointly owned sewing unit led to a brutal murder in Surat. A 25-year-old man was allegedly hacked into five pieces by his maternal uncle after refusing to end their partnership and part with business assets. The nephew had been missing since October 6th, and his body was found dumped in a rivulet.

title: For three years, Madras University had no money to print marksheets

Explosion at US military explosives plant: 19 people missing and feared dead
description: A powerful explosion rocked a military explosives manufacturing facility in rural Tennessee on Friday morning, causing homes to shake and prompting an emergency response. Officials urged the public to stay clear as ongoing blasts prevented access to the site, with no immediate confirmation of casualties. Footage showed burning debris and smoke rising from the facility near Bucksnort.

‘My blood pressure is 150/90. Does it cause any harm. I am 54 years old’
Consumer forum slams Star Health for unfair claim denial, orders Rs 25 lakh payout
Bengaluru: Auto driver arrested for abusing, attacking northeast woman
description: An app-based auto driver was arrested for allegedly abusing and assaulting a woman after she cancelled his ride. The incident, captured on video by the victim, occurred in Bengaluru. The driver, identified as Pavan H. S., reportedly became aggressive when the woman cancelled his booking after he failed to arrive. He has been remanded to judicial custody.

title: Canada's revised border bill: New eligibility criteria for asylum seekers
description: Canada's new Bill C-12 introduces stricter border controls to combat crime and illegal fentanyl, while also aiming to improve the immigration system. The legislation will make it harder for asylum seekers, particularly those entering irregularly or with prior claims in safe countries, to be eligible.

title: Google clarifies HR policy; addresses employee backlash
description: Google has reversed a controversial health benefits policy requiring employees to share personal data with a third-party AI tool. Following employee backlash over privacy concerns, the tech giant clarified that access to benefits is not contingent on using the Nayya AI platform. Employees can now opt out of data sharing with Nayya without impacting their benefits enrollment.

title: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu: Indians' success in US no conspiracy
description: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explains why Indian professionals dominate American technology leadership, attributing it to unintended consequences of the H-1B visa and green card system. The lengthy immigration process made job switching risky, creating committed long-term employees who naturally earned promotions. Vembu emphasises R&D success requires time-intensive commitment, not just funding. His comments come amid controversy over Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B fee.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
description: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: DCC’s Kelli Finglass returns with empowering message in Mississippi
description: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders director Kelli Finglass headlined Forrest Health's Spirit of Women luncheon in Hattiesburg, sharing a message of empowerment and resilience. The event, themed "The Grit Behind the Glam," celebrated women's strength and perseverance.  Finglass's keynote speech, reflecting on her leadership journey, deeply resonated with attendees, marking a significant comeback for the annual gathering.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage with family photos after remarks
description: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, has ignited fan fury with a recent Instagram post after previously admitting she didn't want marriage or children. Her "Life lately" caption, featuring family photos, drew sharp criticism, with followers questioning her sincerity and urging Stephen to reconsider their union. The couple has remained silent amidst the backlash.
